thread.title: Gent 1 Tottenham 0: Awful display from Spurs brightened by Thomas Focket | Metro News
thread.title_full: Gent 1 Tottenham 0: Awful display from Spurs brightened by Thomas Focket | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Gent 1 Tottenham 0: Awful display from Spurs brightened by Thomas Focket | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 7:52 pm Jeremy Perbet celebrates the only goal of the game (Getty) 
Tottenham endured a miserable night in the Europa League this evening, losing 1-0 to Belgian outfit Gent. 
A dismal game at the Ghelamco Arena was decided by a 59th minute strike from Jeremy Perbet which saw Gent beat English opposition for the first time in their history. 
The lacklustre performance from Tottenham was hugely disappointing and it seemed to have fans losing their focus on the football and realigning it on Gent’s right-back. Why? For the very childish reason that he has an unfortunate surname. 
Step forward Thomas Focket. Thomas Foket battles with Harry Kane for the ball (Getty) Davies tackled by Foket…sums up tonight #COYS
